content:
lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">FIFTY-lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">FIVE lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">YEARS since lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Lyndon lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Johnson, stooping on a porch in lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Inez, lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Martin lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">County, Kentucky, declared a “national war on poverty”, lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">America remains an outlier in international comparisons. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">When lass="word-wrap-span">assessed on poverty—lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The share of families making less than 50% of lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The national median income after taxes and transfers—it is among lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The worst-performing in lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The OECD club of mostly rich countries. A special report in lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Economist this week asks how one of lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The richest countries in lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The world can have so many poor people, and asks what can be done about it.

A survey this week revealed lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The extent of lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Gerlass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Many’s economic lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">angst . lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The purchasing-managers’ index, which gauges manufacturing activity, showed lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The sharpest decline since 2009. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Many of lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Gerlass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Many’s problems stem from supply lass="word-wrap-span">disruptions at home. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">But lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Europe has suffered lass="word-wrap-span">collateral damage in lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The trade war between lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">America and lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">China. So, with its largest economy lass="word-wrap-span">languishing, and fears that trade lass="word-wrap-span">headwinds might strenglass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Then, economists are also lowering expectations for growth in lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The euro zone as a whole.

lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Japan is also suffering from trade tensions. Its exports have fallen for nine months in a row. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">With investment also flat, lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The economy relies heavily on lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The consumer. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Yet on lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">October 1st lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Japan will raise lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The lass="word-wrap-span">consumption tax to 10%, in an attempt to improve lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The government’s finances. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">This is lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The latest lass="word-wrap-span">episode in lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Japan’s lass="word-wrap-span">fraught 40-year history lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">With lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The tax . lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The last time it was raised, in 2014, spending plummeted. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">This time, however, consumers have not been splurging in advance.

lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Indian government of Narendra Modi likes to pull surprises. Its latest is a steep reduction in corporate taxes . Businessfolk, morose of late as GDP growth has slowed, snapped out of lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Their malaise. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The main stockmarket index recorded its strongest two-day rise in a decade. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">The cut leaves lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Indian corporate taxation more in line with that of olass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Ther countries. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">But many more reforms—eg, to land and labour laws—are needed if lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">India is to attract supply chains shifting out of lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">China.

It was a good week for lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Britain’s opposition Labour lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Party to hold its annual conference. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Boris lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Johnson was lass="word-wrap-span">embroiled in another personal scandal and found to have broken the law when he suspended lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Parliament for five weeks. Labour did indeed profit from the prime minister’s lass="word-wrap-span">humiliation. lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">But its conference was an unedifying mix of radical policy, fights about Brexit and lass="word-wrap-span">internecine warfare . lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Jeremy Corbyn, its prime-ministerial candidate, is among the least-liked politicians in recent history, more unpopular than even Michael lass="word-wrap-span">ass="word-wrap-span">Foot, a previous left-wing Labour leader.

eg2: My feet are aching.
我的脚疼。
to get/rise to your feet(= stand up)
起立
I've been on my feet(= standing or walking around) all day.
我一整天没歇脚。
We came on foot(= we walked) .
我们是走来的。
walking around the house in bare feet(= not wearing shoes or socks)
赤脚在房子里走来走去
Please wipe your feet(= your shoes) on the mat.
请在垫子上蹭一蹭脚。
a foot pump(= operated using your foot, not your hand)

bare-footed

The nurse hung a chart at the foot of the bed(= the part of the bed where your feet normally are when you are lying in it) .
护士在床尾挂了一张表。
a 6-foot high wall
6 英尺高的墙
We're flying at 35 000 feet.
我们在 35 000 英尺高空飞行。
‘How tall are you?’ ‘Five foot nine’(= five feet and nine inches) .
“你多高？”“五英尺九英寸。”
His boat is an eighteen-footer.

For 'men / may 'come / and 'men / may 'go.
（此诗行四个部分有四个音步）
He landed feet first.
他落地时双脚先着地。
You'll have to carry me out feet first!
想把我撵走，除非让我横着出去！

看来我和新老板的关系一开头就不好。

She put her foot down and roared past them.
她猛踩油门，从他们旁边呼啸而过。
You've got to put your foot down and make him stop seeing her.

She put her foot down and roared past them.
她猛踩油门，从他们旁边呼啸而过。

我真的冒犯了埃拉，我不知道她和汤姆分手了。

Did you go to the party ?
你去参加聚会了吗？
party games
联欢会游戏

学校将带领一个 40 人的儿童团队前往法国。
The theatre gives a 10% discount to parties of more than ten.
剧场给十人以上的团体打九折。
the guilty/innocent party
有罪的╱无罪的一方
The contract can be terminated by either party with three months' notice.
合同的任何一方如提前三个月通知，均可终止本合同。
to be party to a decision
参与作出决议
He refused to be a party to any violence.
他拒绝参与任何暴力活动。
to be party to a decision

希斯洛普对党的贡献是他全身心的投入和十足的干劲。
